newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: PRESS DIGEST - Bangladesh Newspapers - July 20.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Bangladesh Newspapers - July 20.

text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Bangladesh press on Sunday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
At least 16 people, including five jail guards, were injured on Saturday in clashes between some convicts and under-trial prisoners in Chittagong jail.
The Chittagong Port Authorities have threatened to impose the penal rents on imported container cargo if their delivery is not taken within 15 days from the port jetties.
The Indo-Bangladesh Joint River Commission (JRC) began meeting in Dhaka on Saturday after a seven-year gap.
The Khulna Newsprint Mills is trying to export newsprint following the decrease in its demand in the domestic market.
Rebel Shanti Bahini leader Jyotirindra Bodhipriya Larma on Saturday said peace talks with the government would continue and asked tribal people to "have patience and not to be misled".
Trade volume between Britain and Bangladesh stood at 350 million pound sterling in 1996-97 (July-June).
Six labour organisations have called for strike in garment factories on July 24 to press their demand for higher wages and better working facilities.
Nepal would soon get transit facilities through Mongla port.
